intro: Carduus nutans subsp. maurus, commonly known as the common sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white or pale brown seeds. The subspecies is often mistaken for other similar plants due to its similar appearance and growth habits.
